message: if "linkbot" is hitting /live.json, shouldn't DMs to "linkbot" be sent to the live stream?
there's also a read notification in live too iirc.
hmmm we had checked this. It's either new or we missed it. Neat!

now that i'm implementing it, i find some strange things in the results i get from the api regarding direct messages:

* /api/messages.json
- has an array called "conversations", not "messages" (see below)

* /live.json
- includes the conversation_id only if the messages was sent from somebody else
- doesn't say whom i sent a message to -- this currently blocks integration of direct messages into convorsation

* /messages/%s/delete.json vs. /messages/message/%s/delete.json
- this is really confusing and messes with my head ;)
- as the messages.json already has an array called conversations, it comes to mind to move all the the dm calls to /conversations/

@ericflo @leah please consider moving the calls. they are still fresh and it will make things clearer and easier in the future.

and it just happened to me that direct messages appeared in this very topic. i'm sure they will be gone after a refresh, but i think this has something to do with the ambiguous call names ;)
to test this: tab a watches a topic, tab b watches a direct conversation. write a message in tab b and it will appear in tab a.

i think i'm finished for now ;)
live.json now includes a "conversation_user_id" in the "direct-message" kind. just what i needed. thx!
